intro: Amsinckia santae-barbarae, commonly known as the Santa Barbara poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers and hairy, ribbed stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in some areas.
